CatDescriptText: Mr. Mack Terry, 930 Cherokee Street, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, October 18, 1958, pg. A1 with question: "Do you think the Federal Government should immediately enforce the Supreme Court's recent decision in 'Little Rock School Case' or permit the recalcitrant states to take their time in obeying?"  Answer reads: "I think that the Federal Government should enforce the decision right away and with whatever force is necessary. If you keep on giving them time, there never will be any equal rights.  They don't need anymore time.  They've had enough time already."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Mack Terry wearing dark hat, moustache and striped shirt, standing in front of light colored block building with thermometer that reads "Royal Crown Cola", and window on left with sign that reads "Don't Miss Hearing Date With ...athy Show [Pitts]burgh Only Sepia Woman... Jay & Announcer"
